144.title: Gardenia

1441.content:
Gardenia, gym leader of Eterna City, stood at the edge of the vast Eterna Forest. While usually visits to the Eterna Forest were peaceful and calm for the nature-loving Grass-type expert, this time it was all business for her. Due to Team Galactic's shenanigans with their strange tower, the pokemon all throughout the forest had grown crazy and restless, attacking travellers with more force and coordination than usually exhibited. Thanks to a brave young challenger, Team Galactic's operation had been stopped, but the forest pokemon still needed to be pacified. As such, it was up to her.

The orange-and-black-haired young woman checked her gear once more, making sure she was prepared. She was wearing her trusty exploration outfit, a bright green poncho draped over a black long-sleeved shirt whose coverage ended just below her chest, a pair of bright orange cargo shorts held up by a belt, and a pair of forest green hiking boots. Though the outfit left her belly and shins exposed, she was more comfortable in its mobility, and loved to feel the air as she walked through the greenery. Plus, she was more than familiar enough with the forest to avoid any poisonous hazards. Not that it was going to make this task any easier.

From what she could gather from some of the travelers who could escape the forest, the pokemon attacks seemed to be coming sporadically in raids coming from three different parts of the forest, each well-known for a specific type of pokemon. Those would be the places to investigate first. It was even possible that by stopping one of the swarms, the other two would calm down naturally. The dangerous areas were...

The Old Chateau. An abandoned manor on the north side of the forest, surrounded by overgrown plants. Rumor had it that the place was haunted, overrun by all manners of Ghost-type pokemon. Rumors that were recently confirmed, judging from the pale face of the traveler who had reported it to her. Gardenia did not like this option, as she was terrified of ghosts, though she kept such fears secret from the fellow townsfolk.

The Moss-covered Rock. This area in the southern reaches of the forest was well-known as a place where nature's power was strong. Obviously, this would contain lots of Grass and Bug-type pokemon, which Gardenia was very familiar with, giving her the advantage of knowledge, at least.

And finally, the Forest Spring. Along one of the paths in the forest lay a large body of water. Oddly enough, masses of Water-type pokemon from the southwest, near Floraroma town, had gathered in the area. The pokemon, unfamiliar to the habitat, were doubtless causing trouble and agitating the other groups as well. Gardenia knew that her Grass-type pokemon should be effective against them, but a large group of any type of angry pokemon was always a threat, so she would still have to be careful.

Thinking it over, Gardenia made her choice, gathered her supplies, and set off into the forest, heading towards-

Soon enough, Gardenia found herself at the front of the Old Chateau. Though it was still daytime, the old manor seemed as dark and spooky as ever. No ghosts were flying around outside... which meant that she would have to go inside to make sure there was a swarm, and deal with it if there was.

Despite the chateau's proximity to Eterna City, Gardenia had never been inside. She felt a chill creeping down her spine...

It's okay, she thought. It's just nerves, there's no ghosts... yet... Anyways, it's just a spooky old mansion. You can do this!

Taking a deep breath, she opened the door and walked inside.

The inside of the chateau was dark, surprisingly so given how bright it was outside. The light pouring in from outside only penetrated half of the foyer she was now in. Gardenia stepped forward, looking for a light switch.

SLAM!

"Eek!" Gardenia screamed, finding herself in pitch blackness. Something had shut the door behind her!

Whirling around, she tugged and pounded on the door, but it was firmly shut.

"I'm trapped!" Gardenia yelped. "Wait, gotta calm down!" she breathed, reaching into her pocket and pulling out a flashlight.

Turning it on, she checked all around her in a rush. Fortunately, she was alone, though that did little to ease her nerves. Still, being able to see again was progress, at least.

"Okay, okay..." she said out loud. "If I can't get out, then there's no choice other than to go straight on through. Keep it together..."

Searching some more, she found that there were two exits to the foyer. A large door on the first floor in front of her, and a pair of staircases alongside it leading to the second floor.

"Now if I were a ghost, where would I be?" Gardenia pondered, readying a pokeball in her other hand.

choices: Sit and Wait.  Trust the ghosts.
14411112.content:
"Wait, what?" Gardenia asked, and looked downwards. Sure enough, there were red and yellow patches of various sauces and butter dribbled all over the front of her poncho and shirt. "W-When did this happen?" she gasped.

It seems you were so absorbed in our meal that you were a bit careless. the voice replied. We understand it would be rather embarrassing to return in clothes that are in such deplorable condition, so please, allow us to assist you.

"Yeah..." Gardenia replied. She never really cared that much about her appearance, but there was some wisdom to the apparition's words. "So, you don't mind if I just-"

Go right ahead. Simply set them down in front of you and we will take care of the rest.

"All right then," Gardenia said, pulling her poncho off over her head and dropping it to the floor, followed by her shirt a few seconds later. "So, is there some sort of spell or- Hey!"

With startling quickness, her clothes were pulled away into the dark hallway!

No need to worry, Gardenia. said the voice, sounding pleased. They are simply on their way to being cleaned. Now, we must ask that you remain here for a short while. Our cleaner doesn't like to be disturbed while working. But do not fret, all three pieces of your outfit will be returned in short order. Until then, please enjoy your stay.

"Wait, three?" Gardenia asked.

There was no response.

"Hello? Mysterious voice? What did you mean by three?" Gardenia continued, and while she received no answer she did obtain a sudden dreadful notion.

Throwing herself to her knees, she crawled under the dinner table. "No, it can't be," she muttered, searching at first under her chair and then around the whole table. "They were right here."

But gone they were. Her shorts, which should have been at the foot of her chair, were nowhere to be seen. The ghosts must have spirited them away along with the rest of her attire! "But why?" she said to herself. "I'm sure I didn't get any food on my shorts. Did I?"

Checking the chair, she found that it was clean, the only mess being a layer of dust disturbed by her sitting.

"Curiouser and curiouser..."

Just after she spoke, the candles suddenly went out, sending the room back into pitch blackness.

"EEK!" Gardenia screamed, clutching herself in fright. Fright that intensified greatly as she realized for the first time that not only was she trapped in a haunted mansion at the whims of the resident ghosts, she was trapped in this situation wearing nothing but her underwear, a matching green-and-black striped set of bra and panties, and her hiking boots.

"Oh no, oh no, oh no, oh no!" she said frantically, fumbling her hands around blindly on the table. "Please be there, please be there, yes!" she cried out, as her hands found her pokeball and flashlight.

Turning the light on, she scanned the room in a hurry, relieved to find that nothing had changed even though the lights were out. Taking heavy breaths, she dumped herself back into the dinner chair to calm down and gather her bearings.

Bottom line, Gardenia was still presumably trapped in the Old Chateau, and the ghosts now had her clothes, making escape a much less desirable option. The ghosts claimed that they didn't want any trouble, but should she believe them? Ghosts did have a reputation of being notorious tricksters... Still, maybe they just assumed she wanted her shorts cleaned as well. There was an awful lot of dust down beneath that table. And they did give her that nice meal and everything, even if she felt like she was eating more than she normally could...

But, if they had good intentions, that didn't explain why the lights would suddenly go off, why they would vanish without a word, or why they had to be all secretive about cleaning her clothes. There was something suspicious about all this...

"Ugh! Focus, Gardenia," she said, pressing her fingers to her head. "Just sitting here worrying about it is not going to help you! You're going to have to choose: are you going to trust these guys or not?"
14411112.title: Your clothes got dirty, would you let us clean ...

144111121.content:
After much thought, Gardenia decided that if the ghosts were going to try and do something, they would have done so during or shortly after the feast. Besides, they made all that food for her, the least she could do was give them the benefit of the doubt and not freak out at the first sign of spookiness.

So, she sat back and waited.

And waited.

And waited.

"It's taking forever..." Gardenia moaned, clicking her flashlight on and off looking around the room, taking note of what she saw. Peeling wallpaper, check. Cracked floorboards, check. Ominous darkness from the storage room that the light doesn't penetrate, check. Floating piles of clothing, che-"Ah!" she gasped. A folded set of clothes floating towards her in midair was new, so new that she forgot they were hers for a moment! And her shorts were there too. No reason to worry at all.

I apologize that it took so long the voice returned as the clothes came to rest on the table. But here they are, freshly cleaned and good as new.

"Thank you," said Gardenia, quickly putting them back on. "Ooh... so warm! It almost tickles."

As I said, freshly cleaned. Now that everything is in order, you are free to go as you please. Take care, Gardenia.

"Thanks," Gardenia replied and made her way to the front door. With no resistance this time, the door opened up and she found herself outside. It was still daytime, thankfully. With a spring in her step she casually made her way back to Eterna City, almost unable to believe that things went so smoothly, because things never go smoothly

Which, unfortunatley, was the case here as well.

What Gardenia didn't know, and would have nearly given her a heart attack if she did, was that she wasn't alone on her way back to Eterna City. As it was, the ghosts at the Old Chateau had gotten quite bored as of late. Haunting the mansion, scaring the occasional passerby, that was nice and all, but the recent aggression from the Grass and Water types as they vied for supremacy in the forest proper had stopped visitors from coming to the Chateau entirely. Barely any travelers passed by anymore, so when Gardenia had shown up to investigate the mansion herself, they had planned to keep her their for their amusement for a very, very long time.

But then, an extraordinary, outlandish, yet brilliant idea had come to them during the meal. And it would never had come to them if a Gastly hadn't stolen her shorts as a joke and floated around inside of them. Some discussion later and with a resorting of priorities they decided on their new plan. As it was, several Gastly were now compressed and hiding within Gardenia's laundered clothes, hiding within the layers of fabric waiting for the perfect moment to strike. And so Gardenia, blissfully unaware, arrived in Eterna City.

Upon her return, a small crowd of people had gathered, brimming with questions.

"How was the Old Chateau? Were there really ghosts like the rumors described?" asked a man.

"Is the forest safe now?" asked a young girl.

"Find any hidden treasure?" "Or secret passages?" a pair of teenagers asked.

"Okay, okay, everyone relax," Gardenia addressed them. "First of all, the ghosts won't be a problem anymore. I've made sure of that."

"Whoa, really?" a boy asked. "How did you do all that?"

"Oh, I have my ways..." Gardenia said smugly, playing up to the crowd a little.

"Cool!" he said, the crowd awing as well.

Gardenia glanced behind her, she could have sworn something just poked her bottom. "Anyways," she continued, seeing no one behind her. "Just don't go poking around there much for the time being, understood? Their docile now, but we don't want to rile them up like a nest of angry Beedrill."

The crowd agreed heavily on that. "Any plans on dealing with the other pokemon swarms?" a woman asked.

"Well, it's likely that the other two will sort it out among themselves," Gardenia said. "So, probably in a couple days, four tops, the forest will be back to normal."

"Ah..." the crowd mulled over this new information. "Gardenia," an elderly man spoke up. "I just wanted to say, thank you on behalf of everything you've done for us as our Gym Leader. Now, I know it's been a tough day, so I bet you can't wait to-
144111121.title: Sit and Wait.  Trust the ghosts.

1441111212.content:
"Celebration?" Gardenia asked, not very pleased. "You were going to have a party while I was gone?"

"Easy, easy," the old man laughed. "It was originally going to be a strategy meeting to discuss what to do with the swarms using your information. We even invited Crasher Wake of Pastoria City and Fantina of Hearthome City for their Water-Type and Ghost-Type expertise, respectively. But now that you've solved everything on your own, we're turning it into a city-wide celebration! You will be able make it, I assume?"

"Of course!" Gardenia said, not needing to think it over. She knew of the other two Gym Leaders, being a Gym Leader in Sinnoh's league herself, and among the eight of them, Crasher Wake and Fantina were definitely the most passionate. Crasher Wake, who was never seen in public without his signature mask and tights, loved to battle and Fantina, setting the stage in one elegant dress or another, though usually in her shimmering purple dress designed like a Drifblim, loved to perform with her pokemon in Contests, which she considered her own type of battle (though she was by no means a slouch at the real thing.) Gardenia couldn't help feel a little insulted that the City had called for help without her knowledge to deal with her problem, but since everything was taken care of that ill feelings quickly faded away. In fact, she was looking forward to it by now.

Soon enough, the day dwindled down to evening, and the party was starting to get underway. Set around the large statue of Sinnoh's legendary pokemon, tables and chairs filled with food lined the square. A podium was also set up at the foot of the statue, where Gardenia was to give a little speech, helpfully recorded and broadcasted live by Jubilife TV, and then the party would really get underway.

For now though, Gardenia was busy chatting it up with her fellow Gym leaders.

"I'm a bit bummed that there won't be any battling, but I'm amazed you were able to fix this all by yourself!" Wake grinned, clapping a hand on Gardenia's shoulder "That can't have been easy."

"Thanks," Gardenia grinned, swelling with pride. "Once I figured out what they wanted, it was easy. Those ghosts were surprisingly easy to work with."

"Then that is definitely no small feat," said Fantina. "Ghosts can be quite the notorious little tricksters. I have heard of many cases of Ghost-type encounters from those far less fortunate than yourself. Very lucky indeed."

"It wasn't just luck," Gardenia said, though she knew inside that luck was a big part of it.

"I meant no insult," Fantina spoke, smiling. "You have earned every bit of this celebration today, Gardenia. Now, let us enjoy ourselves."

"You got that right!" Wake added. "Knock 'em dead up there."

"Thanks," Gardenia said, as she took her place at the podium and tapped the microphone, getting everyone's attention.

"Attention," she began, noticing the TV crew starting to film her as well. "Thank you all very much for coming here tonight. As you all know by now, the pokemon swarms in the Eterna Forest have been dealt with, and should dwindle down in the next few days."

Cheers rose up from the audience.

"Now, while the grass and water types should become docile again, I'd just like to remind you that the ghost pokemon are still active, and the Old Chateau is still haunted by them."

Some murmurs started to rise up.

"But don't be worried. Above everything else, the Ghost pokemon of the Old Chateau just want to be left alone. Don't cross over the fence into the yard, and you will be fine. So, as for the forest, there is nothing left to fear-"

*THUNK*

Just then, the podium fell to its side, as if something pushed it over. But no one was there. The audience began to grow restless, and even Fantina and Wake were looking concerned. Gardenia herself was confused, but knew she needed to keep things calm. "Uh, sorry about that, just got a little excited," she said, bending down to pick the stand back up.

But as she was about to touch it, the downed podium suddenly slid away from her, almost knocking into one of the tables as it sped off into the night. Gardenia was starting to panic now, breathing rapidly and feeling tightness in her chest. Incidentally, all of her was feeling a little warm, and didn't her clothes felt a little thicker than normal? But before she or anyone else could react, the ghosts seized the opportunity and made their move by-
1441111212.title: "-come to tonight's celebration."

choices: A swarm of Drifblim latch onto Gardenia and start carrying her up into the sky.
Gengar uses Confuse Ray on Gardenia, causing her to make a fool of herself.
14411112122.content:
As panic began to set in, Gardenia could feel her heart hammering, her chest tightening with every breath. But then she realized that it wasn't just her body that was feeling that way, but also that something was straining against her clothes. In a flash, she remembered the events at the mansion, and came to a horrible realization about her host's "generosity".

"N-No- it's-!" Gardenia started to cry out.

But just as she opened her mouth, her clothes suddenly expanded outward; seams straining and bursting as more than a score of ghost Pokemon flew out from her outfit, now mere scraps of cloth that burst away from her. Shocked, the now underwear-clad Gardenia stumbled to catch her footing and look at the crowd staring back in horror. Some of which were directed at her, but most of them, including Crasher Wake and Fantina, staring up above her, mouths agape in shock. Gardenia followed their gazes and breathlessly gasped, as all of the ghost pokemon that had hitched a ride were swirling above in a circle, looking like a giant, purple vortex. Just as Gardenia saw this, however, the ghosts stopped on a dime, turned down toward her, and swooped, cackling wildly.

"AAHH!" Gardenia screamed, falling backwards to the ground and curling up into a ball, shutting her eyes.

Luckily for her, the ghosts just passed over her and kept on going. But everyone else, not so much, as the ghosts flew at the audience instead, flying towards them before the people could react. But right as they were about to fly into people, they seemed to vanish again, leaving everyone with questions.

"W-Where'd they go?"

"Is it over? I've got goosebumps all over..."

"I-Is this part of the show, Daddy?"

"I don't think so, pumpkin. Ms. Gardenia's not the kind to walk around half naked, even for a stunt... and there's also this chill down my neck."

"...coming in live, where several ghost pokemon have just gone haywire..."

The momentary pause gave Gardenia time to assess the situation, blush at the realization of having been stripped to her underwear in front of all of Eterna City and two fellow Gym Leaders, and realize just what the ghosts were about to do.

"E-Everyone!" Gardenia stammered. "The ghosts! They're in your clothes!"

"WHAT!?" everyone gasped. And then, as if on cue, the ghosts made their move again. Buttons were unbuttoned, buckles were unbuckled, and all at once, many in the crowd were finding themselves in the same state as Gardenia as their clothes were removed from their bodies, leaving them just in their underclothes. However, this time, the ghosts did so in a far less violent manner than they did with Gardenia, leaving the outfits intact, but slowly floating away.

"My dress! Come back!" shouted a woman who was now in her underwear.

"No! Why'd I have to go commando today!" wailed a man who was now stark naked.

"My hat!" cried a Youngster, who was just as mortified as the others despite having only lost his hat.

"Hey, rookie! Stop recording me, and get more footage of Gardenia and the other Leaders!" said the reporter, now wearing a fancy, sheer set of lingerie and stockings, as she berated her cameraman.

Sure enough, not even the other Gym Leaders were safe. Fantina had gotten her pokeball ready, only gloves to remove themselves knocking it out of her hand, and then for her dress to follow; billowing upwards over her body and then flying straight into the air. "Well, this is unexpected," she said nonchalantly, seeming perfectly fine in her lacy, yet still fashionable complete set of undergarments: a bustier, corset, garters with garterbelt, panties, and stockings; all a deep, vibrant purple, much like their ghostly assailants.

Crasher Wake was about to unleash his pokemon as well, only for his tights to start sliding down his legs. With a start, he grabbed at them and stopped their descent before they could leave his hips, but then he felt his wrestling mask starting to lift. "Oh no you don't! The mask stays!" he shouted, moving his hands to protect his mask, allowing his pants to be yanked down and pulled to sweep him off his feet. "Oof!" he shouted, rubbing his head and picking himself back up, now only wearing a far duller pair of briefs aside from his mask.

Gardenia looked at all of this chaos happening around her, at everyone losing their clothes to these fiends and chasing after them only to be yanked away at the last moment. Fearfully, she took a step back, and her foot brushed up against something familiar. Quickly, she looked and saw that it was her pokeball. With newfound resolve, she picked it up, held it out and bellowed out, "That's enough, ghosts! You've had your fun, now it's time for you to go home!"

Oh? a familiar voice echoed in her mind, as dark shadows began to come to a pool in front of her, congeal, and rise upward, revealing the form of a Gengar, the apparent leader of this rowdy bunch. But we're having so much fun.

"Fun!? You're just being a bunch of bullies! And it's time someone put you in your place!" Gardenia reached her arm back to throw her pokeball, and a spoon flew down to the ground in front of her. "What!?" Gardenia gasped.

"Gardenia, you got Tricked! Behind you!" Fantina shouted urgently.

Gardenia whirled her head behind her to see a Misdreavus playfully tossing Gardenia's pokeball in front of itself with its telekinesis.

Now then, the voice went again, and Gardenia let out a choked scream as she turned to see the Gengar merely inches away staring up at her. Who was putting whom in their place?

"I-I. W-What do you want!?" Gardenia stammered as she backed away in fear. The Gengar didn't give her an inch, matching her pace perfectly all the way up to the Legendary Pokemon statue.

Why, simply to have a fun time, of course. the Gengar spoke telepathically. We haven't had guests in far too long, so we decided to play at your house instead of waiting for you to come to us.

"So you're lonely? Is that it?" Gardenia shot back.

"Wait! Is it speaking to you?" Fantina interrupted. "Be careful, they can be extremely cunning and tricky to handle!"

"I think we all know that loud and clear!" Gardenia replied, somewhat nonplussed. "But I know what I'm doing! ...I hope," she muttered the last part under her breath. "Gengar," she addressed the pokemon with as much courage as she could muster. "if you keep this up, no one will ever want to visit the Old Chateau again. They'll see you as a threat and might even tear it down out of fear! And you don't want that, do you?"

Hmm! We hadn't considered that. the Gengar's smile turned to a grimace, pondering a possible worst-case scenario.

"Yeah! If you pulled off my mask, I wouldn't rest until you paid for that insult." Crasher Wake followed up.

"And I have studied your kind very, very much," Fantina said, leveling her gaze into a glare. "If you started to pose a serious threat to everyone, I would not hesitate in using that knowledge to bring you down.

"Huh? Can you guys hear him too?" Gardenia asked.

"Oh no, just you darling. But I'm sure you're doing great!" Fantina said with a wave.

"Yeah! I have no idea what's going on, but I believe in you!" Crasher Wake added, and raised his arm to start a hype chant for Gardenia, which only a few people joined in for the moment.

Going around pokemon swarms was bad enough, we don't wish to anger you as well. But pranks are in our souls, and this is the most fun we've had in decades. Now that we've had a taste of a big event like this, we don't want to give it up. the Gengar imparted to Gardenia, with its eyes turned up in a plea for sympathy, followed by loud cries of agreement from the floating ghost-possessed garments.

"Well..." Gardenia sighed, as she couldn't believe that she was about to do this. "Maybe we can work something out. How about if everything goes back to normal for most of the year, but once a year, we can come over to the Old Chateau and you can try your best to haunt us. It'd be a lot like this, but we'd be ready for it-and it wouldn't be stripping all the time!" she hastily added, bashfully bringing her arms in front of her.

But we really liked coming to the city, and once a year is so long though... the Gengar seemed to whine. Sure we live forever, but then it'd be so long to wait... Can't you spare more of your time?

"Haaa..." Gardenia sighed. "Fine, we can do this twice a year, but only one of those days is here at the city, and when it's the city, please try and keep the nudity down? It's embarrassing..." she glanced aside to the camera, which continued to capture the entire scene.

The Gengar, not noticing Gardenia's aside glance, considered her offer. Very well, your terms are acceptable. it finally concluded.

"Yes! They've agreed!" Gardenia cheered, which caused the audience to cheer as well, and the hype chant to actually get started.

But! the Gengar added, raising a finger. We need to finish off the night with one final prank. I trust that you, as our host, will oblige to be the target of this prank?

"Oh! One more thing! They have to prank me first for tonight's finale! Wait, what!?" Gardenia squawked and flinched at the request.

But the cheers were thunderous now. Everyone was chanting her name. The people, the ghosts, and the camera all had their eyes on her, and the other Gym Leaders looked so proud... Gardenia sighed and took a deep breath, swallowing the last of her fear. "All right, then. One final prank on me! Give it all you've got!"

The crowd's cheers grew even more as the Gengar snapped its fingers. In doing so-
14411112122.title: Stripping off Gardenia's clothes.

144111122.content:
No, she couldn't trust the ghosts. It wasn't just her phobia of the supernatural and occult talking here (considering how she handled the meal, she felt that she was actually doing pretty well in that regard,) but there was just something odd about everything that has happened to her the whole time she was here. Sure, the ghosts could have learned her intentions by reading her mind, and therefore know her name and the reason she was here, but that didn't explain why there would be such a large feast for a surprise guest. The more she thought of it, the more it seemed like that the feast was less as a gift, but more as a way to put her off her guard, and to keep her here.

But if this was a trap... why? None of the attacked travelers who encountered the ghosts ever told such a tale, they were just spooked and ran off. So why was it different for her?

Gardenia shook her head. Whatever the reason was, she would have to learn it from the ghosts themselves. And preferably not with them holding her clothes hostage. With her pokeball in one hand and flashlight in the other, the half-naked Gym leader steeled herself and crept back towards the foyer.

The foyer was as large and imposing as before, and also just as empty. "Well, only way to go is up," said Gardenia, making her way upstairs.

Arriving on the landing, Gardenia saw that the second floor of the Chateau split off into a series of rooms all along the far wall, as well as two more rooms in the corners. As Gardenia drew closer, however, she could hear a muffled thumping coming from the nearer corner room.

"Looks like I found them..." she said nervously, tightening her grip on her equipment.

As a chill crept down her spine, surely due to equal parts unease and exposure, she edged towards the room the noise was coming from and tested the handle. It was unlocked. Taking a deep breath, Gardenia slowly pushed the door open, shining her light into the room.

The room was small, windows covered with drapes just as it was in every room, and contained only some boxes and old appliances, strewn about along the walls. However, in the corner of the room, one of those appliances was whirring with activity, no doubt the source of the noise Gardenia had heard. Shining her flashlight on it, she recognized it to be an old washing machine.

"Whew... there we go," Gardenia sighed with relief. "Those darn ghosts! Such a big build-up and fuss over a simple, ordinary washing machine..."

Getting a closer look, she could see her clothes tumbling away inside and that the machine was still on its wash cycle with another 15 minutes to go before drying began. "Looks like I'm alone here. Well, don't want to be here any longer than I have to," said Gardenia, as she pressed the STOP button on the machine.

Bzt! the machine buzzed.

...

But the machine kept running!

"Huh?" Gardenia pressed the button again.

Bzt! the machine buzzed again, but continued just as it was before.

"What is wrong with you?" Gardenia growled, getting angry and pressing the STOP button multiple times.

Bzt! Bzt! BzzZZZZRTTTTT! the machine buzzed, suddenly shuddering all over and crackling with electricity.

"Uh oh..." Gardenia whimpered, cringing.

Gardenia, though not a technological expert by any means, knew that something bad was about to happen. With her limited knowledge, she was expecting a malfunction or a miniature explosion. What she did not expect was the washing machine's water hose yanking itself out from its drainage pipe in the wall and pointing at her.

"Wha- Oof! PBBBBTTTBBTBT!!"

Gardenia was so stunned at the sight that she had no chance to ready herself as she was blasted with an intense spray of water from the hose. The force of the blast knocked her off her feet and back into the boxes, pinning her against them. Mercifully, the deluge only lasted several seconds, but it was enough to leave her completely soaked and winded, her pokeball and flashlight knocked out of her hands and fallen in front of her.

Catching her breath, Gardenia looked in front of her, and couldn't believe her eyes. The washing machine, now wrapped in an eerie blue aura, was now making its way toward her, marching on two stubby little legs poking out from the underside, with the deadly hose trailing on the ground alongside of it. At the top of the device, what looked to be a horn poked out in the center, and the START and STOP buttons were now slanted at an angle and-

"DID THEY JUST BLINK!?" Gardenia screamed.

A small crescent appearing under the circles confirmed her fears. The buttons were now eyes. That crescent was a mouth. There was now a face on the center of this washing machine. This washing machine was ALIVE!

Bzzzooeee! went the washing machine, making a noise that sounded like an unholy combination of a radio and a UFO.

That cry was enough to spur Gardenia out of her shaken stupor and into action. Adrenaline rushing through her body, she did the first thing her instincts told her to do, and that was to-
144111122.title: Investigate. Something's not right...

1441111222.content:
Scrambling to her feet, Gardenia threw herself forward, scooped up her pokeball, and dashed towards the door. Luck was on her side as she escaped into the foyer, narrowly avoiding getting hit with another watery blast from the washing machine. The foyer was as dark as ever, but Gardenia was too terrified to care. If the appliances were starting to attack her now, then what next? The chandeliers? The carpets? Even the doors themselves? She had prepared herself to fight off ghost pokemon, not an entire haunted mansion!

Reaching the stairs, she shuffled down them as quickly as she could, using a bannister for guidance. Once she reached the bottom, she sprinted full out towards the front door, the only known exit. "Please be open, please be open..." she pleaded hopefully, remembering how it was stuck earlier. But maybe now...

Gardenia grabbed the doorknob, twisted and...

It opened!

"YES!" Gardenia whooped, opened the door and charged through, relieved to finallly see the outside again.

But the sight that greeted took that relief and devoured it in despair. In front of her, where the Chateau's lands connected with the rest of the forest, there floated an entire squad of ghost pokemon. Gastly, Misdreavus, there were dozens of them hovering above the border, and even a few Haunter as well; all grinning that dreadful, malicious Ghost-type grin. Worse, the trees in the road had grown back while she was inside, penning her in with the ghosts.

"If I knew there were this many, I would have brought more than just Roserade," Gardenia said dully, overwhelmed by her situation.

Going somewhere? a familiar, but now far less friendly voice intruded Gardenia's mind.

Gardenia gasped, her skin crawling with a sudden chill, shivering all over. Slowly, she turned around.

Standing inches away from her, staring up into her eyes, was a Gengar. Even though she knew it was the strongest and deadliest of the Gastly line, she always thought she would have preferred running into one of these if she had to. With having a fully-formed body, it seemed more real and less spectral than its unevolved counterparts, and was less frightening to her. But now, staring into its pale red eyes, their malevolent gaze boring into her soul, and that awful smirk on its face, she could feel her heart threatening to burst from her chest.

"I'm dreaming, I have to be," Gardenia said hollowly, her face white as a sheet. "I'm soaking wet, in my underwear, and surrounded by Ghost pokemon. This has to be a dream."

This is no dream, Gardenia, said the voice as the Gengar waggled a claw condescendingly. Or else we would have consumed it by now. Such a waste. A dream with the fear you are feeling now would be quite delicious indeed. He he he... it laughed, with the ghostly horde following suit.

"Eeeeeee..." Gardenia whimpered, flinching backwards, pulling her arms together.

Now, the Gengar raised its arm, cutting off the laughter. What to do with you? Spurning our hospitality and running around unsupervised is very rude, you know.

"Please," Gardenia begged, falling to her knees and bowing. "Just let me go. You just wanted to be left alone, right? If I don't return, there'll be search parties, with Ghost experts, and they'll tear this whole place apart until they find me!"

Heh heh. Ha ha ha! the Gengar and ghosts laughed again. Just let you go? Well, I admit, it was my fault leaving you, our honored guest, unattended. But still, we can't just overlook you disturbing poor old Rotom like that.

Rotom? Gardenia noticed, but was too worried to dwell on it.

Okay, I've decided. the Gengar continued. We'll just curse you permanently as a reminder to keep your nose out of Ghost business, and then we'll be even.

"C-CURSE!?" Gardenia shrieked.

Don't worry, you won't feel a thing, Gengar said, its grin somehow more sinister than normal as a pitch-black nail materialized above its hand. Now, what to curse you with? Haven't cursed a human in- HEY!

While Gengar had been musing, Gardenia had leapt to her feet and bolted towards the forest. As a loud roar echoed behind her, the ghosts hovering above began to swoop down to block her path. Gardenia, in turn, sped up as fast as she could go, but she was too late, the ghosts were already in position over the fences she had planned to hop over.

Looking back, she saw the Gengar floating towards her. It had dispensed with words, but Gardenia couldn't help but feel its expression read, "Nowhere to run now."

But there was option Gardenia saw that Gengar hadn't considered. If only there was a little more time it would be a cinch but... there wasn't so she'd have to do this the hard way. Taking a deep breath, threw herself headlong into the thicket blocking the road. The dense branches, needles, and leaves were stubborn, poking and scraping at Gardenia's body, but she was stubborn as well, not to mention that fear of deadly curses is great motivation. Soon enough, with a great crash, the greenery gave way and Gardenia fell through. A ghastly wail roaring behind her, she hurriedly picked herself up and hightailed it back to Eterna City.

Gengar looked scornfully at the thicket, and at the surrounding ghosts, who seemed to be wearing expressions of disbelief and shame, save for a couple Haunters poking around the bush. Gengar growled at the Haunter pair, who turned around startled, each holding something in their hands. With one look at their new acquisitions, Gengar leaned back and laughed. It then made a gesture with his claws, and returned with the Ghosts to the Old Chateau.
1441111222.title: Run away!

14411112221.content:
Gardenia was short on breath as she trudged into Eterna City, but there was no time to be exhausted. What if the ghosts had followed her? She had to prepare for an attack! She needed the rest of her pokemon, some supplies, and anyone willing to help hold them off.

"Ah!?" went a gasp to her left.

Looking in that direction, Gardenia saw a young boy with a bicycle. Perfect, Gardenia thought. "I... need your help," Gardenia panted as she caught her breath, walking up to him.

"M-Ms. Gardenia?" the boy stammered, cheeks red. "Y-you're-"

"I know," Gardenia blushed. "I know, but that can wait. Listen to me, the Old Chateau was tougher than I thought it would be. I barely made it out of there in one piece. Even worse, there may be a bunch of angry ghosts on their way here right now."

"Ghosts?" he asked, nervously glancing aside.

"Yes, Gastly, Haunter, you know. Anyways, I need you pass this along to everyone in the city. Ghosts are coming, if you have pokemon that can fight, meet me at the entrance to Eterna Forest immediately, can you do that?"

"Um, yes, but shouldn't you-?"

"This is more important, now let's go!" Gardenia yelled, running towards the city, the boy following and overtaking her on his bike, pointedly avoiding looking directly at her. Sheesh, I know there aren't many beaches in Sinnoh, but you'd think he'd at least seen a girl in a bikini before... she thought.

Gardenia's first stop was the Eterna Gym. While the rest of her team was stored in the PC Box system, she didn't have any way to carry more than two pokeballs, and there was a bag with supplies there that could suffice. Not many people were outside yet. Hopefully there would be more to help soon enough. Once inside the gym, she headed directly through the grass-themed stage towards the challenge podium at the back, where she kept her extra equipment in a space under the floor. It took nearly no time at all to get what she needed.

"G-Gardenia!?" a shocked gasp rang out.

Looking back, Gardenia saw that her three disciple trainers were standing behind her, mouths agape.

"W-What-"

"I had a run-in with ghosts. They nearly got me, and they may be coming to the city," Gardenia said authoritatively to the other girls. "Get to the Eterna Forest entrance, I'll be there soon."

"But you're-"

"GO!" Gardenia yelled.

The three trainers, all very flustered, awkwardly made their exit as Gardenia checked her supplies. Super Potions, Antidotes, Revives, and most importantly, space for pokeballs. Hoisting her pack over he shoulder, she then left and made way toward her final destination, the Pokecenter. Running inside, she was pleased to find that the center was nearly empty, except for the nurse at the counter, and that the PC wasn't being used. "Yes!" she said to herself, as she begun the transfer.

"Gardenia!" the nurse shouted, eyes wide, having come down from the upstairs.

"You've heard, right? About the ghosts?" Gardenia asked as she placed her pokemon team into her bag.

"Yes, but I thought he was making it up," the nurse. "Since he said you were... and here you are..."

"Look," Gardenia stamped her foot, frustrated and fed up. "I'm sure that everyone is just dying to know why I'm running around in my underwear right now, and I will tell you how that happened, I promise. But only after I'm sure that the swarm of ghosts isn't going to haunt us to death because I got careless, okay!? So until then, stay here and keep the healing machines ready in case we need them, got it?" and with that she turned around and stormed outside.

Outside, Gardenia glanced towards the forest entrance, glad to see a large crowd had arrived. In fact, it looked like the whole city had shown up! With this many, the ghosts wouldn't know what hit them. With all this running around, she should have been exhausted, but seeing everyone there was enough to give her a second wind.

"Coming through, S'cuse me!" she said as she made it to the crowd. Thankfully, the crowd backed up, allowing her to take her place at the front lines. Less thankfully, as passed by she heard the unmistakeable noise of several murmurs about her, all of which focusing on one things that she was sick of hearing. And that was how shocking it was that she would run around like that. Gardenia groaned, as she made her way up, and stared at the forest.

Crouching to the ground, she readied Torterra's pokeball and scanned the forest. The chattering in the crowd grew louder. "Quiet, please!" Gardenia called out. "I need to concentrate."

The crowd quieted down, truthfully she didn't need to do anything except watch, but all the talking behind her back was getting very annoying.

A minute passed, and no noise from the forest.

Then five minutes, and still no action. The crowd was beginning to work itself up again. Come on, something happen soon. she thought.

At minute ten, a rustling came from the bushes at the forest edge. Gritting her teeth and gripping her pokeball, Gardenia prepared herself.

Out from the bush sprang forth-

A lone Wurmple, crawling about.

"Ah..." Gardenia sighed heavily and smiled. If the normal pokemon were wondering the forest at peace, then the ghost army would not be there. They were safe.

Standing up and facing the crowd, she announced. "It looks like the ghosts aren't attacking us after all. The Old Chateau seems to be their territory. If no one goes in, no one will be attacked by ghosts, at least. With that, the other two swarms should cancel each other out, and the forest should be safe soon enough. Sorry for bringing you all out here for nothing, though," she grinned sheepishly.

Sounds of relief and cheering rushed through the crowd, but instead of dispersing like Gardenia thought it would, it grew closer to her. And the faces of the crowd were still filled with concern and confusion.

"So, just what happened out there?" a man's voice piped up. "It must have been really something for you to end up like this."

"Yeah, it's not like you would have taken your own clothes off in there, right?" a child asked.

"Regardless, I don't think I could have come back to town like that," said an older woman. "I would have been way, way too embarrassed."

"Argh!" Gardenia pressed her hands to her forehead. "What are you all freaking out over? It's just my underwe-" she looked down at herself, and was met with bare flesh. Not a single piece of clothing was in sight, save for her boots.

Eyes growing wide, Gardenia finally realized why the air felt a little extra weird after she escaped from the Old Chateau. At least it wasn't curses. "-we -we -we -WEAUUUGGHH!" she screamed, hunching down and crossing her arms over her body, sending the crowd into a new wave of talk and curiousity over Gardenia.

Was it the ghosts? The branches? Either way, she didn't care anymore. She just streaked and flashed her entire body to all of Eterna City after all! Everyone all over got a total eyeful. And if they didn't while she was running around, they sure as heck did now. And she was too scared and panicked to realize it. And they were still getting it!

"Outta my way!" Gardenia screamed, as she ran and shover her way through the crowd towards the safety of her house, covering up as best she could. Using her spare key in her bag, she got in, locked the door, and immediately fell to the floor, exhausted. Today was a complete nightmare... the exhibition she just went through was merely icing on the cake. And while today was bad enough, once word gets around to the other cities... Too tired to think on it anymore, she started a shower to recuperate and clean up-

*KNOCK KNOCK*

-but was interrupted halfway through, with a clamor outside of her house. Grumbling, she securely fastened a towel around her body and went to her door, opening it a crack.

Sure enough, most of the city was outside.

"What do you want?" Gardenia asked with a mixture of exhaustion, tiredness, and anger.

"But what happened at the Chateau, though?" a member spoke up.

"I'll tell you in the morning," Gardenia said flatly, and slammed the door shut.
14411112221.title: Back at Eterna City...

14412.content:
Stepping over the fields of the rock, Gardenia felt the nature around her becoming more alive. The place seemed louder with every progressing step, from songs passed down from the grass towards the birds above.

Like the grass called to the birds to yank off its bugs, the ground beneath Garnedia’s feet called out the Pokémon to ward her off. At least, she assumed so.

Nearby, Pokémon of various sizes joined together, despite their differences, surrounded a group of unfortunate trainers who foolishly gained up on a family of evolving Eevees. Once the trainers knew their situation, they quickly given up on their potential catch and attempted to scram away from the grass creatures.

From the crowd of grass Pokémon, a Scyther jump out to claw on the tank top of the girl trainer. It made heinous hissing sounds from it’s mouth when it hastily pulled back its arm from the struck trainer, ripping off her top portion of her body. The girl screamed quite a bit of terror out of her system, quite a bit of embarrassment came from the mouth as well.

The Scyther wasn’t quite done with her, it wanted to make her hurt very very badly. It once again positioned its claw at the girl, aiming it from the same area as before.

Before it could do what it wanted, Gardenia’s Cherrim landed a solar beam on the back of its head, knocking off its conscious. Quickly, two more Pokémon come forward to hold their grips on the half-naked girl.

Looking the gap the two Pokémon left in the predatory circle, Gardenia realized her options. Her and the other trainers could runaway from the horde, leaving the girl behind with the distracted Pokémon. Or, Gardenia would rescue the girl and stay behind to allow all of the trainers to leave from the area, which would eventually worn out the gym leader herself.
14412.title: The Moss-covered Rock.

choices: Rejection: she goes into the usual routine of Pokémon fights
144122.content:
As much the desirable choices stared at her, Gardenia couldn’t stand the idea of having a defenseless trainer in the hands of uncaring beast. She knew full well what the Pokémon were capable of, but that girl in the two Pokémon’s arms didn’t.

The grass gym leader called on to her Cherrim, “Cherrim! Wait for my call!” Her body span around in one quick motion, catching the amateur trainer’s attention. “Keep your arms wide and open! It’s an order!”

The trainers wouldn’t rebuttal her. They followed suit in her orders, giving the gym leader a cocky smirk.

“Alright! Cherrim, uselessly sunny day!”

The already bright environment got brighter, the grass-types had so much energy in them, they dropped to the ground. The rest of the Pokémon were blinded, covering up their eyes, and trying to recover from the shock.

Gardenia grasped at the girl, knowing full well that the captors lost their grip. She grabbed the poor girl then tossed her to her friends.

She shouted, “Leave! It’s not going to last long.”

The trainers scrammed out of there, tripping over some of the Pokémon along the way.

Quickly, the environment undid the status effect. The environment didn’t exactly returned to the way it was before. The lighting was the kind a person would see in the middle of a day of a somewhat warm playground, which didn’t completely fit in with the ways the area of the moss rocks.

The worn out grass Pokémon breathed deeply to this more abnormal state of this environment, relieving themselves. The blinded Pokémon still struggled to see, yet they looked where Gardenia was.

The trainer felt scared despite seeing the state of the painfully weak group of monsters. Her stressful still body gotten the better of her. The weakened grass types sprouted up a root to cling on her boot. She yanked her foot of the trapped shoe in caution.

The removed sturdy item ended up crashed up from the grass Pokémon. For some reason, some of the grass Pokémon still kept crushing on it, trying to break it apart.

Apart from the loss the clothing, Gardenia felt two opposed sensations on her feet. The covered foot still felt the oppression from the ground. The bared toes met with a different treatment, massaged comfortingly on the ground.

The gym leader had a wacky idea. Could she go through with it?
144122.title: Gardenia stays and gets overwhelmed

choices: A normal Pokemon trainer (Hilda, Rosa, Bianca, etc.)
A Gym Leader (Lenora, Elesa, Skyla, Iris, Roxie)
Part of the Elite Four (Caitlin, Shauntal)
154.content:
The Unova region. A diverse region in the world of Pokemon that is home to a wide variety of conflicting experiences. From large urban cities to small rural towns, a vast desert surrounded by snowy mountains, all lined with bountiful coastlines, diversity and the conflict it brings can be traced back to the region’s history, back to its founding and the legendary Pokemon representing the clash of truths vs. ideals.

Additionally, with each zone’s climate varying with the seasons more strongly than any other region, there is always excitement to be found whether one went looking for it or not. However, for this story, our leading lady will be going through a different sort of excitement or conflict than the type they are normally used to.

The main Unova girls include:

Hilda, the main character of Black/White. A hot-blooded young woman who loves battles. Can be very intense.

Rosa, the main character of Black 2/White 2. A high-spirited young woman with a strong sense of justice. Has had some acting experience.

Bianca: One of the rivals from Black/White: A friendly young woman who is on a journey to find her purpose in life. Can be flighty at times.

Lenora: The stalwart Normal-Type Gym Leader of Nacrene City. Also is passionate in her work as an archaeologist.

Elesa: The stunning Electric-Type Gym Leader of Nimbasa City. Has a mesmerizing presence as a model that captivates everyone, but also possesses an offbeat sense of humor.

Skyla: The cheerful Flying-Type Gym Leader of Mistralton City. A cargo pilot who loves nothing more than taking it to the limit flying with her Pokemon; with or without her airplane.

Iris: The exuberant Dragon-Type Gym Leader of Opelucid City, who eventually becomes the Unova Champion. Is rumored to understand the hearts of Dragon-type Pokemon, and has the skills to back it up.

Roxie: The rockin’ Poison-Type Gym Leader of Virbank City who also plays bass guitar in a band. Gives her all in her duties as both a Gym Leader and a musician.

Caitlin: The refined Psychic-Type member of the Elite Four. Possesses latent Psychic abilities which she is still learning to fully control.

Shauntal: The imaginative Ghost-Type member of the Elite Four. A novelist who is always seeking inspiration for her next work.

To narrow down the choices, the trainer who will be the star of this story is...
154.title: Trainers of Unova

1541.content:
An ordinary Pokemon trainer. A youth free to chase whatever dream they wish, though most end up challenging the Gyms and League of the region at some point. But regardless of their end goals, there is always a new adventure to be had with their Pokemon by their side.

The main character of this adventure will be...
1541.title: A normal Pokemon trainer (Hilda, Rosa, Bianca, ...

1542.content:
A Gym Leader. The main checkpoints of any Pokemon League challenge, these individuals have the responsibility of challenging all who seek the League championship. Additionally, as the strongest trainers of their respective cities, they also have a duty to its people. Resolving local issues and helping the city in general is just as important as taking on prospective challengers, and adding their own personal hobbies on top of that can make the life of a Gym Leader very busy indeed.

The main character of this story will be...

154231.content:
The high-flying Gym Leader of Mistralton city. This outgoing trainer has an optimistic view, always looking on the sunny side of life no matter how stormy the weather gets. This is also in a physical sense as well as metaphorical since the weather can get quite stormy in that particular region of Unova.

However, Skyla’s about to get hit by an event no forecast could’ve predicted. Where does this story begin?
154231.title: Skyla

choices: Exploring and training for high-speed flight
Doing special delivery service across Unova
1542312.content:
It was a bright, sunny day in the Unova region. With the wind at a gentle breeze and nary a cloud in the sky, Pokemon and Trainers across the region were out and about making the most of it. But few were as so full of energy as the Gym Leader Skyla, who at that moment was speeding across the highlands near Mistralton city on the back of her beloved Swanna.

“WOOHOO!!! This is the best!” Skyla cheered.

There were few things Skyla loved more than flying with her Pokemon, especially Swanna. Though she also has her own airplane, there was a certain rush to feeling the wind whipping across her as she sped across the land; and it gave a chance for Swanna to cut loose and show her stuff too!

Skyla planned to make the most out of such a beautiful day. Her plans today involved...
1542312.title: Outside of town

choices: She is interrupted before takeoff by Hilda, who’s also come to help Clay.
She runs into some surprise stormy weather on the way to her first destination.
Something happened at her first destination, while delivering an item.
15423122.content:
While it was a perfect day to relax, Skyla had some business to to take care of. Clay, the Gym Leader of Driftveil City, conveniently neighboring Mistralton to the southeast, was in a bit of a jam. The city’s main delivery barge had broken down. Driftveil City was one of the major export and shipping hubs within the Unova region, and as such provided the number-one delivery service for its people. The barge was already being repaired as quick as it could, but the goods still needed to be delivered in a timely manner, so he had called upon Skyla for help.

Skyla, eager to help out, soon touched down in Driftveil City, much to Clay’s surprise. “Whoa!” he exclaimed, startled by her sudden landing. “Well, you certainly don’t waste any time!”

“That’s the idea, hee hee!” Skyla chuckled. “Delivery is right up my alley, and I’m always happy to lend a hand to a friend in need.”

“That’s the spirit! Ha ha!” Clay barked, clapping his hands together. “Now, let’s get you all set up,” he continued, guiding Skyla over to a nearby warehouse, where several workers were hauling many boxes and loading them into crates.

“Whoa, that’s a lot of stuff,” Skyla said, in awe of the volume of goods being processed. “Are you sure you didn’t need me to bring the plane for this?”

“I’ve still got plenty of trucks, so I’ve got a handle on most of the deliveries. But there’s a few time-critical deliveries that need to arrive faster than the trucks can manage,” Clay explained.

“Oh! You mean like across the sea to the furthest reaches of the region?” Skyla asked.

“Yeah, but there’s also some closer to home too,” he answered, and continued leading Skyla until they reached a large pile of packages. It wasn’t as big as the loads the other workers were handling, but it was still a significant amount for one person to handle. “Here we are,” he said.

“This is... a bit more than I was expecting, honestly,” Skyla said with a nervous grimace.

“Can’t he helped,” Clay shrugged. “All of these are express delivery items that need to be delivered today, and most of them are almost at their refund deadline. I know it’s a bit much but this is expected for Unova’s number one delivery service. Think your shoulders can handle the weight?” he asked, making stern eye contact with Skyla.

Skyla looked back at Clay, a little uncertain at first, but quickly steeling her resolve. Delivery was part and parcel for her wheelhouse, after all. She was more than used to delivering goods herself, even if it had been a while since she had taken so many by hand at once. “Don’t worry, Clay. This girl’s ready for takeoff!” she declared.

“Good!” Clay smiled back, though the intensity of his stare didn’t lighten one bit. “Let’s get you all loaded up and ready to go.”

Soon enough, Skyla was ready to depart, mounting on Swanna once more but now wearing a large backpack filled To bursting with a variety of goods. Swanna seemed a little unsure with the extra weight on her back, but Skyla was confident the two of them could handle it. She was also provided with a list of the deliveries by Clay, and she saw that these trips would be taking her pretty much around the entire Unova region. Excited to be able to get in an entire day’s worth of flying while doing some helpful work, she geared up to take off and start her journey.

But while Skyla expected this to be just another routine package delivery day, she would instead remember this to have been quite an ordeal, for a variety of reasons. The first of which was...
